page.title: 13Cameley Hedgerow i
page.content:
South facing hedges in the area e.g. Cameley Road,have an abundance of plant life.One of the earliest flowers is the yellow celandine(Ranunculus ficaria).These are followed by the green of the cow parsley(Anthriscus sylvestris),then the cuckoo flower (Cardamine pratensis) and the wood anemone(Anemone nemorosa).Then the yellow of the primrose(Primula vulgaris),the blue of the bluebell (Endymion non-scriptus) and no doubt the common dog violet(Viola reviniana) is lurking somewhere. A little later some red campion(Silene dioica) and stitchwort(Stellaria graminea) appear.Then nettles(Urtica dioica), brambles(Rubus fruiticosus) and goosegrass(Galium aparine) take over.
{ See also 'Cameley Hedgerow ii'}
